commits.author: Robert Muir
commits.sourceNew:
/** * getSize() returns the number of categories in the taxonomy. *

* Because categories are numbered consecutively starting with 0, it * means the taxonomy contains ordinals 0 through getSize()-1. *

* Note that the number returned by getSize() is often slightly higher * than the number of categories inserted into the taxonomy; This is * because when a category is added to the taxonomy, its ancestors * are also added automatically (including the root, which always get * ordinal 0). */ public int getSize();
commits.sourceOld:
/** * getSize() returns the number of categories in the taxonomy. *

* Because categories are numbered consecutively starting with 0, it * means the taxonomy contains ordinals 0 through getSize()-1. *

* Note that the number returned by getSize() is often slightly higher * than the number of categories inserted into the taxonomy; This is * because when a category is added to the taxonomy, its ancestors * are also added automatically (including the root, which always get * ordinal 0). */ public int getSize();

commits.author: Shai Erera
commits.sourceNew:
/**
   * Returns the number of categories in the taxonomy. Note that the number of
   * categories returned is often slightly higher than the number of categories
   * inserted into the taxonomy; This is because when a category is added to the
   * taxonomy, its ancestors are also added automatically (including the root,
   * which always get ordinal 0).
   */
  public abstract int getSize();
commits.sourceOld:

* Because categories are numbered consecutively starting with 0, it * means the taxonomy contains ordinals 0 through getSize()-1. *

* Note that the number returned by getSize() is often slightly higher * than the number of categories inserted into the taxonomy; This is * because when a category is added to the taxonomy, its ancestors * are also added automatically (including the root, which always get * ordinal 0). */ public int getSize();
